db:abstract.db:para: The QBluetoothAddress class assigns an address to the Bluetooth device.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: This class holds a Bluetooth address in a platform- and protocol-independent manner.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QBluetoothAddress::QBluetoothAddress(const QString &address)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a new Bluetooth address and assigns address to it.
The format of address can be either XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX or XXXXXXXXXXXX, where X is a hexadecimal digit. Case is not important.

db:section.db:title: [explicit constexpr noexcept] QBluetoothAddress::QBluetoothAddress(quint64 address)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a new Bluetooth address and assigns address to it.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool QBluetoothAddress::isNull() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the Bluetooth address is null, otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: QString QBluetoothAddress::toString() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the Bluetooth address as a string of the form, XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] quint64 QBluetoothAddress::toUInt64() const
db:section.db:para: Returns this Bluetooth address as a quint64.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept, since 6.6] size_t qHash(const QBluetoothAddress &key, size_t seed = 0)
db:section.db:para: Returns the hash value for the key, using seed to seed the calculation.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.6.

db:section.db:title: bool operator!=(const QBluetoothAddress &a, const QBluetoothAddress &b)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the two Bluetooth addresses a and b are not equal, otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: bool operator<(const QBluetoothAddress &a, const QBluetoothAddress &b)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the Bluetooth address a is less than b, otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: bool operator==(const QBluetoothAddress &a, const QBluetoothAddress &b)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the two Bluetooth addresses a and b are equal, otherwise returns false.
